meanings.definition: relating to or characterized by accretion
meanings.sent1: The accretionary process slowly builds up layers over time.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the accretionary patterns in the rock formations.
meanings.sent3: The accretionary growth of the coral reef amazed the divers.
meanings.sent4: Her accretionary knowledge of plants expanded like a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: The accretionary nature of the snowball rolling down the hill made it grow rapidly.

meanings.definition: tending to accumulate or grow by gradual addition
meanings.sent1: The accretionary savings in her piggy bank added up over time.
meanings.sent2: The accretionary dust on the old bookshelves showed years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: His accretionary habit of collecting stamps filled his entire room.
meanings.sent4: The accretionary effect of positive thoughts transformed her outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The accretionary layers of paint on the canvas created a textured masterpiece.
